other_tests.findings: The patient’s plasma revealed no detectable apoC-II, with a level below the detectable limit of 1 mg/dL. Functional apoC-II activity was absent.
No discernible band corresponding to apoC-II was observed in the patient’s plasma, confirming the absence of functional protein.
A homozygous missense variant c.215G>C in APOC2 was identified, translating to p.R72T in apoC-II.
